review_title: Mission-driven and Flexible, Advancement is Ambiguous
pros: Great benefits and work life balance, unlimited PTO and a flexible remote work policy. Fulfilling commitment to mission that is prioritized across the organization.
cons: Compensation is fair compared broadly to the nonprofit sector, but low in comparison to true CDFI peers. The organization has undergone significant structural changes over the past few years which has contributed to instability and staff attrition. The employee experience varies greatly depending on the department, especially considering investment in professional development, quality of leadership, and opportunities for advancement. It's generally difficult to grow, but the organization treats it's staff well enough and it's a friendly place to work at the mid or senior level.

review_title: Values-driven, great work-life balance, clear compensation structure
pros: What other consulting practice manages to a 35 hour work week? Great flexibility for those with family commitments, nice work from home policies. Projects are assigned carefully to ensure a good mix of projects that allow you to grow professionally, and avoid over-burdening team members. You have a say in what you want to take on. Compensation bands are public internally, so you know whether you fall at the low-end or high-end of compensation for your position. The advancement process is as transparent as I've ever seen. Organizational values - Equity in Action, Generosity of Spirit, Leading by Doing, Responsiveness, and Rigor Without Attitude - are lived internally and externally. They play a front and center role in assessments of ourselves as individuals and of our work. There's room for all voices and perspectives to be heard. Our CEO, Antony, publicly owns mistakes and apologizes sincerely, then does better. He's a great role model for the entire team to be able to do the same and to learn and grow. We openly discuss issue of race and racial equity, and are constantly striving to do better.
cons: Departments internally are siloed, which can make for clumsy client experiences when moving from work with one department to another. This is something we are constantly striving to improve, but we haven't figured it out yet. The organization is really careful and process oriented, which can sometimes be overwhelming and cause us to miss opportunities.

review_title: Great place to learn with great clients but lack diversity
pros: This is a great place to learn nonprofit finance, consulting, and working in the social sector. In mid-to upper-level positions, there is considerable flexibility to work where and when you need to work (depending on client deliverables of course) - very outcomes-oriented. Most staff are enjoyable to work with and you will get the opportunity to travel to client sites and other offices.
cons:
Lack of diversity especially at the senior level 

There is also a lack of diversity in thought which constrains new ideas and innovation. Leadership will seldom incorporate 'front line' consultants' ideas into product or service delivery.

Upward mobility is fairly biased, obscure,  and rests in the control of one or two people.

Lack of face-to-face time with clients, mostly phone and video
